intro: Sorindeia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa, particularly Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Sorindeia somalensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
